author: stas
msg: if the handler sets the content-type, don't parse the headers because
there most likely there will be none

author: stas
msg: can't use "plan $r, ..." in the handler if raw headers are sent, otherwise

author: stas
msg: we have no choice but to truncate wb->outbuf to the size of 'len'. All
kind of weird problems pop-up when the previous request was proper and the
current request has messed up with headers, because
will get things messed up because it expects a buffer with real data only.
